intro: Actinolepis mutica, commonly known as the rough-leaved actinolepis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
